data.title: GPS Coordinates for old mines.
data.meta_description: I've been messing around with mabe going out to some of these old mines jsut to check them out so i did some looking around found this whole list of GPS...
data.text:
I've been messing around with mabe going out to some of these old mines jsut to check them out so i did some looking around found this whole list of GPS coords for a ton of older mines. I only copied A-E theres alot more so if you want I'll post them up. From putting the coords in Google Earth they do go to mines.

of that list, about 70% are closed and reclaimed, overall in the state the concensus is that about 40% of the mines have been reclaimed.

I only mention cause it sucks to get all the way out to a site and then not be able to see the mine, or most times, have to invoke RS2477 to follow a road to a mine that has been destroyed (reclaimed) .there is a much more comprehensive list that is available for download direct to GPS but it will fill most memory cards, its about 800k. is there a way to post a link to the file here?

of that list, about 70% are closed and reclaimed, overall in the state the concensus is that about 40% of the mines have been reclaimed.

I only mention cause it sucks to get all the way out to a site and then not be able to see the mine, or most times, have to invoke RS2477 to follow a road to a mine that has been destroyed (reclaimed) .there is a much more comprehensive list that is available for download direct to GPS but it will fill most memory cards, its about 800k. is there a way to post a link to the file here?

Is it on your web site? If not and it will zip down to 580KB you can attach it.. if not email it to me and I'll host it for awhile.

meat_ @ rockymountainextreme.com

Is it on your web site? If not and it will zip down to 580KB you can attach it.. if not email it to me and I'll host it for awhile.

meat_ @ rockymountainextreme.com

yeah, I can host it as well if meat doesn't want to. Either way, send it to me caleb @macjunk.org (no space) I'd like to have that. BTW, is it 800k or 800MB? I don;t know if there is a current GPS that has less than 800K memory, especially if you're using a memory card.
